case_vignette: A 33-YEAR-OLD BLACK MAN PRESENTS TO A DERMATOLOGY CLINIC WITH A 5-MONTH HISTORY OF ASYMPTOMATIC LESIONS ON HIS ARMS AND TRUNK. HE IS OTHERWISE HEALTHY WITH NO PERSONAL OR FAMILY HISTORY OF SKIN DISEASE. HE HAS NO HISTORY OF FEVER, COUGH, SHORTNESS OF BREATH, OR JOINT PAIN. THE PATIENT HAS NOT TRIED ANY TREATMENTS FOR THESE LESIONS. ON EXAMINATION, THERE ARE SEVERAL SMOOTH, WELL-DEMARCATED HYPOPIGMENTED PLAQUES ON HIS UPPER ARMS AND LEFT FLANK. HE HAS NO SIMILAR LESIONS ELSEWHERE ON HIS BODY.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have some painless light-colored patches on my upper arms and left side of my torso.
How long have you had these patches?
I've had these patches for about 5 months.
Have these patches changed in size or spread to other areas during the 5 months?
No, the patches have not spread to other areas of my body.
Do the patches appear scaly or dry, and are they itchy?
No, the patches are not scaly or dry, and they are not itchy.
Do you have any existing medical conditions or are you currently taking any medication?
I am otherwise healthy and have no personal or family history of skin disease. I'm not on any medication.
Have you had any recent exposure to sunlight or any changes in skincare products that might have triggered these patches?
No, I have not had any recent changes in skincare products or specific events like excessive sunlight exposure that might have triggered these patches.
Final Diagnosis: Vitiligo

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient came in reporting light-colored patches that are painless on their upper arms and left side of their torso, noticeable for approximately 5 months. The patches have not spread to other areas, and they are neither scaly nor dry, nor do they cause any itching. The patient confirms they are otherwise healthy with no personal or family history of skin disease. They are not currently taking any medications. Additionally, there has not been any recent change in skincare products or specific events like excessive sunlight exposure noted that might have triggered these patches.
